To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch

To All HR Recruiters & Hiring Managers.  A Small but Crucial Request!When posting job requirements, many recruiters mention language proficiency, such as:✅ "Must speak Arabic"✅ "Fluent in English required"But what does that really mean?Are you looking for:🔹 Basic conversational skills? (Can handle daily interactions)🔹 Professional working proficiency? (Can manage emails, reports, and meetings)🔹 Native-level fluency? (Can negotiate deals, write contracts, and represent the company)Without specifying the required proficiency level, many qualified candidates might hesitate to apply, fearing they don’t meet the unclear expectation.💡 A simple fix: Use CEFR levels (A1-C2) or descriptive terms like "Basic," "Intermediate," or "Fluent." This way, you'll attract the right candidates without discouraging potential talent.Let's make job postings clearer and more inclusive! What are your thoughts on this?hashtag#HR hashtag#Recruitment hashtag#LanguageProficiency hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch
